definitions: social occasion for welcoming guests or celebrating an event
process of receiving or being received somewhere or by someone
quality of broadcast signal received by radio or television
way ideas or proposals are received and responded to
examples: The wedding reception lasted until midnight with dancing
They held a reception for the visiting diplomats
Patient reception takes place at the main desk
The hotel reception operates twenty-four hours daily
Mobile phone reception was poor in the mountains
The television reception improved after adjusting the antenna
The proposal received a lukewarm reception from investors
Her new book enjoyed an enthusiastic critical reception

definitions: person employed to greet visitors and answer telephone calls at an office or hotel
examples: The receptionist scheduled my appointment for next Tuesday
Hotel receptionists must speak multiple languages fluently nowadays

definitions: specialized cell or group of nerve endings that responds to sensory stimuli
device or substance that receives and responds to signals or stimuli
examples: Pain receptors in the skin alert us to danger
The drug blocks dopamine receptors in the brain
The satellite receptor picks up signals from space
Chemical receptors detected the presence of toxic gases

definitions: period of temporary economic decline with reduced trade and industrial activity
act of receding or withdrawing from a position or place
examples: The country entered a recession after the financial crisis
Many businesses closed during the severe economic recession
The recession of floodwaters revealed extensive property damage
Scientists observed the glacier's gradual recession over decades

definitions: relating to genetic traits that appear only when two copies of the gene are present
examples: Blue eyes are a recessive trait requiring two copies
The disease follows a recessive inheritance pattern in families

definitions: tendency of convicted criminals to reoffend and return to criminal behavior after punishment
examples: Prison programs aim to reduce recidivism rates significantly
The study examined recidivism among juvenile offenders over time

definitions: set of instructions for preparing a particular dish including ingredients list
method or procedure for achieving a particular result or outcome
examples: My grandmother's cookie recipe uses secret ingredients carefully
The recipe calls for two cups of flour
Their business strategy proved a recipe for disaster
She shared her recipe for maintaining work-life balance

definitions: person or thing that receives or is awarded something valuable or important
examples: The scholarship recipient thanked the donors during graduation
Multiple recipients shared the prestigious Nobel Prize award

definitions: given, felt, or done in return between two parties equally
mathematical expression obtained by dividing one by a given quantity
examples: Their reciprocal respect strengthened the business partnership considerably
Countries established reciprocal trade agreements benefiting both economies
The reciprocal of five equals one divided by five
Students calculated reciprocals during their mathematics lesson today

definitions: practice of exchanging things with others for mutual benefit or corresponding advantage
examples: Diplomatic reciprocity ensures balanced international relations between nations
The principle of reciprocity governs many social interactions

definitions: performance of music or dance, especially by one performer or small group
detailed account or enumeration of facts, events, or items in order
examples: Her piano recital showcased pieces from various composers
The dance recital featured students of all ages
The lawyer gave a lengthy recital of precedent cases
His recital of grievances lasted nearly an hour

definitions: musician or performer who gives recitals, especially as a professional soloist
examples: The renowned recitalist performed at Carnegie Hall yesterday
Young recitalists competed for the prestigious music scholarship

definitions: act of reciting memorized material aloud before an audience or class
examples: Students practiced their poetry recitation for the competition
The morning recitation of prayers brought community members together

definitions: action or process of calculating or estimating something mathematically or financially
time when past actions are judged and consequences must be faced
examples: By my reckoning, the project will cost fifty thousand
The accountant completed the financial reckoning before year-end
The day of reckoning arrived for corrupt officials
Environmental damage will bring an inevitable reckoning soon

definitions: process of claiming back or recovering land from sea, desert, or waste
recovery and reprocessing of waste materials for reuse in manufacturing
examples: Land reclamation created new agricultural areas from marshland
The reclamation project transformed the abandoned mine site
Water reclamation helps conserve resources in drought-prone regions
Metal reclamation from electronics reduces environmental waste significantly

definitions: process of assigning something to a different class or category than previously designated
examples: The reclassification of Pluto sparked scientific debate worldwide
Job reclassification resulted in higher salary grades for employees

definitions: act or state of leaning or lying back in a relaxed horizontal position
examples: The patient remained in a reclining position during examination
Reclining chairs provide comfort for extended viewing sessions

definitions: person who lives a solitary life and tends to avoid other people deliberately
examples: The author became a recluse after achieving fame
The mountain recluse rarely ventured into town for supplies

definitions: ability to identify someone or something from previous encounters or knowledge
acknowledgment of achievement, service, or ability through praise or reward
examples: Facial recognition technology improves security at airports worldwide
The patient showed no recognition of family members
She received recognition for her humanitarian work overseas
The award represents recognition of exceptional scientific achievement

definitions: sudden backward movement caused by release of force or impact
act of drawing back in fear, horror, or disgust from something
examples: The rifle's recoil bruised his shoulder after firing
The cannon's recoil shook the entire gun platform
She felt a natural recoil from the gruesome scene
His recoil from violence shaped his pacifist philosophy

definitions: action or faculty of remembering something from the past; a memory recalled
examples: Her recollection of childhood events remained remarkably clear
Witnesses provided conflicting recollections of the accident scene

definitions: suggestion or proposal about the best course of action to take
formal statement of someone's good character or qualifications for position
examples: The committee's recommendation influenced the final policy decision
Doctors provided dietary recommendations for improving health outcomes
She wrote a glowing recommendation for her former student
Job applicants need three professional recommendations from supervisors

definitions: compensation or reward given for loss, suffering, or effort made on behalf
examples: Workers received financial recompense for workplace injuries sustained
The court ordered recompense for damages to property

definitions: restoration of friendly relations after conflict or estrangement between parties
action of making financial accounts consistent by comparing and adjusting differences
examples: The reconciliation between former enemies brought lasting peace
Family reconciliation occurred after years of painful estrangement
Monthly bank reconciliation ensures accurate financial records maintained
The accountant performed reconciliation of inventory discrepancies carefully

definitions: military observation of region to locate enemy or ascertain strategic features
examples: Drone reconnaissance provided valuable intelligence about enemy positions
The reconnaissance mission gathered critical information before attack

definitions: act of considering something again, especially with view to changing decision
examples: The board announced reconsideration of the rejected proposal
Upon reconsideration, she accepted the challenging job offer

definitions: action or process of rebuilding something that has been damaged or destroyed
process of recreating past events or structures based on available evidence
examples: Post-war reconstruction required massive international financial assistance
The city's reconstruction after the earthquake took years
Historical reconstruction revealed how ancient Romans actually lived
Crime scene reconstruction helped investigators understand the sequence

definitions: permanent account of information or facts preserved in writing or other form
best performance or most extreme example of its kind officially recognized
disc or tape bearing recorded sound for playback on audio equipment
examples: Medical records contain patient treatment history and diagnoses
The court record includes all testimony and evidence presented
She broke the world record for marathon running time
This summer set records for highest temperatures ever measured
Vinyl records have regained popularity among music collectors recently
The band released their first record to critical acclaim

definitions: device for recording sound, images, or data for later playback
wooden or plastic wind instrument with finger holes and whistle mouthpiece
person who keeps official records or acts as junior judicial officer
examples: The voice recorder captured the entire business meeting clearly
Flight recorders provide crucial information after aviation accidents
Children learn to play the recorder in elementary music class
The baroque recorder produces a sweet, mellow tone
The court recorder transcribed all testimony during the trial
The county recorder maintains property ownership documents officially

definitions: sound or moving images that have been preserved on tape or disc
process or action of capturing audio, video, or data for preservation
examples: The recording of her concert became a bestselling album
Security recordings showed exactly what happened that night
Recording sessions lasted twelve hours in the studio
The recording of witness testimony requires special equipment

definitions: process of counting votes again to verify election results accuracy
act of telling someone about something, giving all details in order
examples: The election recount confirmed the original winner's narrow victory
Manual recount of ballots took several days to complete
His recount of the adventure captivated the entire audience
She gave a detailed recount of the meeting proceedings

definitions: act of telling or describing events or experiences in detail sequentially
examples: Her recounting of wartime experiences moved listeners deeply
The witness began recounting the events leading to accident

definitions: source of help in difficult situation; option for obtaining assistance or justice
examples: Victims have legal recourse through the court system available
Without recourse to loans, the business would certainly fail

definitions: return to normal state of health, mind, or strength after illness
process of economic improvement after period of decline or recession
action of regaining possession or control of something stolen or lost
examples: Her recovery from surgery progressed faster than doctors expected
Full recovery from the injury required six months rehabilitation
Economic recovery began showing signs after stimulus measures implemented
The market recovery exceeded analysts' most optimistic predictions
Data recovery from damaged hard drives requires specialized expertise
The recovery of stolen artwork involved international cooperation

definitions: activity done for enjoyment when one is not working or studying
action or process of creating something again from memory or imagination
examples: Outdoor recreation includes hiking, camping, and nature photography
The recreation center offers swimming and basketball facilities
Historical recreation of ancient battles requires extensive research preparation
The artist's recreation of the scene impressed museum visitors

definitions: person newly enlisted in armed forces or newly joining an organization
examples: Military recruits undergo twelve weeks of basic training
The company welcomed twenty recruits to the sales department

definitions: person whose job involves finding and enrolling new members or employees
examples: The corporate recruiter interviewed dozens of candidates weekly
Military recruiters visit high schools seeking potential enlistees

definitions: action of finding and enrolling people for employment, membership, or service
examples: Recruitment efforts focused on attracting top engineering graduates
The recruitment process includes multiple interviews and assessments

definitions: plane figure with four straight sides and four right angles at corners
examples: The garden forms a perfect rectangle measuring twenty by thirty feet
Students calculated the rectangle's area using length times width

definitions: action of putting right something that is wrong or inaccurate officially
examples: Error rectification in the database required careful systematic review
The rectification of injustices became the movement's primary goal

definitions: electrical device that converts alternating current into direct current flow
examples: The power supply's rectifier converts household AC to DC
Silicon rectifiers replaced vacuum tubes in modern electronics

definitions: clergy member in charge of Anglican or Episcopal church parish
head of certain universities, colleges, or schools in various countries
examples: The rector delivered an inspiring sermon on Sunday morning
Parish members elected a new rector after retirement
The rector presided over the university graduation ceremony officially
Students petitioned the rector about campus housing concerns

definitions: final straight portion of large intestine terminating at the anus
examples: The doctor examined the rectum during routine colonoscopy procedure
Rectal cancer screening saves thousands of lives annually

definitions: period of recovering health or strength after illness, exhaustion, or exertion
examples: Post-surgical recuperation requires adequate rest and proper nutrition
The athlete's recuperation from injury lasted several months

definitions: fact of occurring again, especially of something unwelcome like illness
examples: Cancer recurrence remains a concern for many survivors
The recurrence of flooding prompted new prevention measures

definitions: process of converting waste materials into new materials and objects for reuse
examples: Recycling reduces landfill waste and conserves natural resources
The recycling center accepts paper, plastic, and glass

definitions: color at the end of spectrum next to orange resembling blood
political position associated with socialism, communism, or left-wing politics
examples: The red sunset painted the sky in brilliant hues
She wore a stunning red dress to the gala
Red states typically vote for conservative political candidates
The red flag symbolized the revolutionary movement's ideals

definitions: process of editing text for publication, especially removing sensitive information
examples: Government redaction obscured classified information in released documents
The redaction of personal data protects individual privacy

definitions: person who redeems someone from sin, error, or evil in religious context
person who saves, rescues, or liberates someone or something from difficulty
examples: Christians believe Jesus Christ is humanity's divine redeemer
The redeemer figure appears in many religious traditions
She viewed education as society's redeemer from ignorance
The new CEO became the company's financial redeemer

definitions: action of defining something differently or changing its accepted meaning fundamentally
examples: The redefinition of marriage sparked nationwide political debate
Technology forced redefinition of traditional workplace boundaries completely
